meta.content: Technology; Corrections; Books; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

abstract.p: Corrections of New Economy column on Oct 9 about views of John Seely Brown, concerning investment firm Twelve Entrepreneuring

block.p: The New Economy column in Business Day on Oct. 9 about the views of John Seely Brown, former director of the Xerox Palo Alto Research Center and the author of ''The Social Life of Information,'' misstated his role at the investment firm Twelve Entrepreneuring. He joined the firm after it was created by Eric Greenberg, Halsey Minor and Benchmark Capital; he did not create it with them. The article also misspelled the surname of the firm's chief strategy officer. He is John A. Hagel III, not Hegel.

The New Economy column in Business Day on Oct. 9 about the views of John Seely Brown, former director of the Xerox Palo Alto Research Center and the author of ''The Social Life of Information,'' misstated his role at the investment firm Twelve Entrepreneuring. He joined the firm after it was created by Eric Greenberg, Halsey Minor and Benchmark Capital; he did not create it with them. The article also misspelled the surname of the firm's chief strategy officer. He is John A. Hagel III, not Hegel.
